poem:
### Morning Dispatch

In Jamaica, the air hums  
with urgent whispers—  
a song of survival,  
as the ocean eyes the shore  
with greedy interest.

Mountains stand as sentinels,  
watching for the change,  
while we, the architects of fate,  
linger in tangled negotiations,  
waiting for the ink of promises  
to dry in time.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘This is survival’: Jamaica leads calls from vulnerable nations at Cop30 Jamaica has led calls from vulnerable nations at the Cop30 climate summit to urge immediate action on climate breakdown as the conference entered its second week. As high-level ministers from governments around the world took over negotiations in Belém, Brazil, vulnerable nations lined up to say how important it was that wealthier countries cut emissions in order to limit the worst effects of global". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
